column4: I am trying to setup vnc login (number 4), I have put a line in /etc/services, and restart /etc/openbsd-inetd, now with netstat something should be listening on port 5904 ?
yes or was it 5903 for the 4th session .. can't remember exactly
actually, you might not see anything with netstat as you have inetd running vnc .. but you probably would see an open port if you used a port scanner
telnet says the port is closed.
why not use a vncviewer ?
I did, but I wanted to check the port, so I used a simpler program.
i understand the reasoning for using telnet .. but in my experience with inetd, telnet is not always reliable
oh!  didn't know that
and I am using the binary package.
run this first.  sudo apt-get build-dep openssh
will the compile/install openssh ?
why not use the binary package?? why are you building from source?
I want to put in some extra stuff (prints etc.) to see how it works...
sudo apt-get build-dep openssh # will install the dependencies needed to complete the build .. you'll have to run ./configure again
so it wont do the compile etc.
apt-get source -b openssh # will - but that defeats the point of you making customizations to the source
thanks I will try that.
wow, 62 new packages.
require??  those should cover it
but /etc/g{shadow,passwd} might be used too
pcb is?
ok I will give it a try.
